Class Media

  • java.lang.Object
    • Media
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Media>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Episode, Movie, Series

    public abstract class Media
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Media>
    Project #3 CS 2334, Section 010 March 28, 2016

    Media is an abstract class defining data and methods common to movies, broadcast series, and broadcast episodes. It also contains an anonymous comparator for sorting Media objects by year.

    Version:
    1.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String title
      The title of the Media
      private java.lang.String uniqueID
      The identifier which differentiates Media with identical title and year
      private Year year
      The release year(s) of the Media
      static java.util.Comparator<Media> YEAR_COMPARATOR
      Stores an anonymous comparator object for comparing Media by release year(s).

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Media otherMedia)
        Compares two Media objects lexicographically by title and then by unique identifier.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Media>
        Parameters:
        otherMedia - The Media object to compare this to.
        Returns:
        The value of this.title.compareTo(otherMedia.title) when it is non-zero and this.uniqueID.compareTo(otherMedia.uniqueID) when the titles are equal.
